questions.question: While cleaning his room, Paul found 7 cents on his desk, 98 cents under his bed, and 2 dollars and 4 cents in his closet. What was the total amount of money Paul found?
Which comparison is NOT true?
The graph shown represents the rule y = x + 1.5. Which table contains only values that represent the rule?
Priscilla built a cabinet shaped like a rectangular prism. The length of the base is 9 inches, and the width is 40 inches. What is the area of the base of the cabinet in square inches?
What is the quotient?

Wanda's net income for the month of April was $2,438. The table shows her April budget except for an amount in the 'Other' category. What amount, in dollars and cents, should be in the 'Other' category in order for Wanda's April budget to be balanced?
One bucket of gravel has a mass of 7.05 kg. What is the mass of 20 buckets of gravel in kilograms?

The students in a class were each given a set of letters and asked to make words. The dot plot shows the numbers of students who made from 1 to 7 words. What fraction of the students in the class made 5 or more words?
Which list shows all of the ways this triangle could be classified?
George bought 3 peppers for a cost of $0.40 each. The model represents this situation. Which equation shows how to find the total cost in dollars and cents of the peppers George bought?
A student will graph the point (5, 3) on a coordinate grid. Which steps can the student take in order to graph the point correctly?
options: Start at the origin. Move 5 units up. Move 3 units right. Graph the point.
Start at the origin. Move 5 units right. Move 3 units right. Graph the point.
Start at the origin. Move 5 units up. Move 3 units up. Graph the point.
Start at the origin. Move 5 units right. Move 3 units up. Graph the point.
questions.correctAnswer: Start at the origin. Move 5 units right. Move 3 units up. Graph the point.

questions.question: What is the value of the expression shown? 4[4.5 - 2(1.2)]

Paula wants to buy 3 shirts and 2 belts. The shirts cost $16.89 each, and the belts cost $8.97 each. Paula has $45. Which of these amounts is the best estimate of how much more money Paula needs in order to buy the shirts and belts?
Ella finished a bike race in 37.6 minutes. Miranda finished the race 9 1/10 minutes sooner than Ella finished it. How many minutes did it take Miranda to finish the race?
Four students each wrote down a number between 30 and 40. Which student wrote down a prime number?
What is the value of this expression? 1/12 ÷ 36
The graph shows three of the four vertices of parallelogram VWXY. At which location on the coordinate grid could point Y be located?

A family spent $93 at a carnival. They spent $18 on tickets and $36 on food. They spent the rest on games. Which equation can be used to find g, the amount of money in dollars the family spent on games?
A student builds some rectangular prisms using cubes that each have a volume of 1 cubic inch. Which rectangular prism has a volume of 12 cubic inches?
Shauna is reading a 528 page book. She reads 22 pages every day. How many days will it take Shauna to read the entire book?
The equation y = 1.5x can be used to determine y, the number of cups of water needed to cook x cups of rice. Which table shows the relationship between x and y?
A temperature in degrees Fahrenheit is shown in expanded notation: (9 × 10) + (4 × 0.1). How is this temperature in degrees Fahrenheit written as a numeral?

Mark has $5.25 in quarters. He spent all this money on 3 sports drinks. He spent the same amount for each sports drink. Which equation can be used to find the amount of money Mark spent for each sports drink?
The length of one wall in Mr. Shelby's classroom is 29 feet. What is the length of this wall in inches?
An electronic book has a file size of 2.4 megabytes. What is the file size in megabytes of 16 of these electronic books?
This Venn diagram is being used to classify two types of quadrilaterals. Which type of figure will always belong in the shaded section of this Venn diagram?

A chef used 1/4 cup of milk for one recipe. Then she used 2 cups of milk for each of 5 more recipes. The total number of cups of milk the chef used can be found by using this expression: 1/4 + (2 × 5). How many cups of milk did the chef use?
What is the perimeter of the hexagon in feet?
There are 16 pies on a picnic table. Each pie is cut into pieces. Each piece is 1/8 of a pie. How many pieces of pie are on the picnic table?
Elias has three containers of cooking oil. Which list shows the containers in order from least to greatest volume in liters?
options: Container X, Container Y, Container Z
Container Y, Container X, Container Z
Container Z, Container Y, Container X
Container Z, Container X, Container Y
questions.correctAnswer: Container Y, Container X, Container Z

questions.question: Mr. Fernández packed 31 red apples and 41 green apples into a box for a customer. He packed 8 boxes like this. Mr. Fernández used this equation to find x, the number of apples he packed into all the boxes: x = (31 + 41)8. How many apples did Mr. Fernández pack into the boxes?
Which of these is NOT an example of a property tax?
options: Tax paid on the value of a farm a person owns
Tax paid on the value of a piece of land a person owns
Tax paid on the value of a piece of furniture a person owns
Tax paid on the value of a home a person owns
questions.correctAnswer: Tax paid on the value of a piece of furniture a person owns

questions.question: The table represents a relationship between x and y. The relationship between the x-values and y-values creates a pattern that is —
options: additive, because each x-value increases by 5
additive, because each y-value is determined by adding 17 to the corresponding x-value
multiplicative, because each y-value is determined by multiplying the corresponding x-value by 17
multiplicative, because each x-value is a multiple of 5
questions.correctAnswer: additive, because each y-value is determined by adding 17 to the corresponding x-value

questions.question: The stem and leaf plot shows Ryan's math scores so far this year. What is the sum of Ryan's greatest math score and least math score?
The weight of sand in a large bag is 63.4 pounds. The sand in the bag is divided equally into 20 small bags. What is the weight in pounds of the sand in each small bag?

Henry used a number machine to create ordered pairs of numbers. Each number he put into the machine, x, came out as a different number, y, based on a rule. Some ordered pairs from Henry's machine are shown. Which graph best represents the ordered pairs from Henry's number machine?
